result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Davis DOC #00496991 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Starts forthwith.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample.

**AMENDED** 9/20/17 Extended supervison is 5 years.

Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Defendant Michael T Davis  in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 9:41/9:46 Court recessed to allow defendant to have a call patched into courtroom, to make statement on his behalf.9:51 Court resumed. Defendants mother made a statement to the court. Sentencing recommendations argued. Defendant made a statement to Court. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 years in prison consecutive to any other sentence. 2 years initial confinement, 7 years extended supervision. $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration program, and substance abuse program.
In Limine, Hearing requested, filed by Atty. Ron Benavides

filed by Court Reporter Cathy Braunschweig, July 16, 2015 preliminary hearing
Wis. Dells Police Dept.  Report page 14.  Marked exhibit #3 for preliminary hearing.
Filed by ADA Crystal Long

Defendant Michael T Davis in court, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant would like to have Atty Raabe withdrawn from his case.  State objected, this is the second time defendant has wanted to terminate his atty during a preliminary hearing.  Court will proceed today.  Court recessed to allow atty Raabe to discuss with defendant if he is going to proceed today with or without atty Raabe 9:28.  Court back on record at 9:36.  Defendant would like to proceed alone.  Court advised Atty Raabe to remain available today for defendant during this session.  Defendant objected, made statement.  Court advised defendant preliminary hearing will be held today.  State called witness (Officer Albrecht).  Direct examination.  Cross examination by atty Raabe.  Exhibit #1 marked (aerial map).  Defendant cross examined witness.  Exhibit #2 marked (police report).  Atty Raabe requested it be marked and received.  Court received exhibit #2.  Redirect by State.  State called next witness (Officer Cournoyer).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Defendant cross examined witness.  Redirect by State.  Recross by atty Raabe.  Defendant requested to testify.  Atty Raabe advised him not to.  State objected to defendant testifying.  Court has found probable cause at this time.    Information filed, reading waived. Defendant entered not guilty plea. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  Speedy trial requested by defendant.  Defendant would like to continue to retain Atty Raabe.  Court granted request Atty Raabe is to remain on this case.
